primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from spiritual distress, fragmentation, and idolatry to wholeness and salvation through the act of 'looking' at God/Jesus.

subject.identificatie: The Hearer/Individual (represented by Spurgeon, Isaiah, MLK Jr.)
tekstueel_bewijs: I decided to take my problem to God.
to be saved, to be 'whole', no longer divided
find our own key, our gift, our pace

zender.identificatie: God (as the source of the invitation/command)
tekstueel_bewijs: Look unto me, and be ye saved... for I am God

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / 'All the ends of the earth'
tekstueel_bewijs: be ye saved, all the ends of the earth
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (the one who must look).

helper.identificatie: The Preacher/Circumstances (The snowstorm, the unknown preacher, the death of Uzziah)
tekstueel_bewijs: God brings many things together... to direct and guide his people.
The fury of the storm compelled him to turn down a side street.
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Object of the look or the Helper (arranging circumstances), rather than the active Subject of the salvation verb.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (an 'inner voice' or 'presence' that supports the subject).

tekstueel_bewijs: dark and painful brooding of his heart
Our idols have to be pulled down
something or somebody stands between us and our vision
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is framed as a 'divided mind' or 'confused spirit' rather than a cosmic or legal enmity with God.

secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Saved Individual (Spurgeon/The Pastor)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Salvation (finding one's key) leads to effective service and influence.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will be at your side
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you will discover that so much of it goes back to the fact that we need to be saved

voorbeelden: Our idols have to be pulled down
I know no better wish that I could have for you
he decided to take his problem to God
discover that so much of it goes back to...
I am at the end of my power

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'will' of the hearer to look. It assumes that if the hearer is motivated (Vouloir) to look, salvation (Object) is achieved.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Distress) through ~S1 (Confusion) to S1 (Wholeness) via the act of Looking.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the human act of 'looking' which triggers the divine presence.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as psychological unhappiness rather than ontological death or judgment.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high-gospel language (Spurgeon, Christ), the actantial structure is anthropocentric: the human 'look' is the engine that activates God's help.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The word salvation comes from the Latin salvus, which means healthy or whole.
Spurgeon did look... and in that moment I saw the sun.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: all the ends of the earth

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Spurgeon, Isaiah, and MLK Jr. are used as models of how to 'look' and find success.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Instead of 'Isaiah looked,' focus on 'God revealed Himself to Isaiah when he was blind to Him.'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform the 'look' correctly to achieve wholeness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God is available, but the human must initiate the connection.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent but shifts the definition of salvation from 'forgiveness of sins' to 'psychological integration'.
spanning_punten: The shift from Spurgeon's 'burden of soul' (guilt) to the preacher's 'finding your own key' (self-actualization).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Look to Jesus Christ... uncertainty disappeared; he was ready.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides 'presence' to help the subject stand, rather than being the Subject of the new birth.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as 'cobwebs' or 'caking'—surface issues blocking a view, rather than a dead state.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is the human 'look'. God is the Object/Helper. This creates a subtle moralism of 'correct looking'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'looking' and 'finding wholeness'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the subject of 'seeking' and 'finding'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Look to God,' use 'God has turned His face toward you in Christ so that you cannot help but see Him.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Receiver' who is looked upon by God.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Spurgeon was 'found' by the storm and the preacher, not that he 'found' his key.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Dominance of Devoir (Look!) and Vouloir (Find your key).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (God's power to save the one who cannot look).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how God enables the 'look' in the first place.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Sin as a spiritual blindness that only a miracle can cure.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'unhappiness', the 'look' is a choice. If the opponent is 'blindness', the 'look' is a gift.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Soteriology is fused with vocational success.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Separate the gift of salvation from the 'finding of one's key' to avoid making grace a tool for self-actualization.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and uses great examples, but it risks turning the Gospel into a psychological technique for wholeness. Shift the verbs back to God's action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is excellent (pathos, examples). Actantially, it is anthropocentric.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Isaiah 45:22 is used as a springboard for a therapeutic definition of 'salvus'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the name 'Jesus' appearing, the 'Subject' of the action is consistently the human ego seeking integration.

volledige_subject_lijst: Dr. King reached the breaking point
I decided to take my problem to God
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids legalism (rules) but falls into 'therapeutic moralism' (the duty to be whole).
